availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Robert Williamson and Eliza Williamson. Married to Elizabeth V. George Williamson in Montgomery County, Tennessee, on December 14, 1857. Father of William A. Williamson, D.L. Williamson, and L.F. Williamson. Student in Wilson County, Tennessee, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed E. A. Wilcox as a farmhand in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person hired out to W. H. Calvert in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Wilson County, District 4, p. 552A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, 99.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 220A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 471B.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Montgomery County, 1838-1874: Marriages, p. 49.
"Alfred Williamson (1823-1891)," Find A Grave, Memorial #18569395, accessed January 31, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18569395.
